channel.title: Getting someone's i.p adress through msn messenger
channel.description:
Obtaining an IP from MSN Messenger.
----------------------------------
Step 1 - Start MSN Messenger and login as yourself.
----------------------------------
Step 2 - Hit your "Start" button and click run. Type into the white box "Command" (without the quotation marks)
----------------------------------
Step 3 - Type in "Netstat -N" (without the quotation marks) into the black box and hit enter.
----------------------------------
Step 4 - Start a conversation with your 'victim' and send them a file. Once they accept the file Hit your "Start" button and click run. Type into the white box "Command" (without the quotation marks) and Type in "Netstat -N" (without the quotation marks) into the black box and hit enter.
----------------------------------
Step 5 - Look in the middle column of both your MS Dos boxes and look in the newer wndow for the IP address that has magically appeared in the middle column. This is your victim's IP Address.

item.title: Getting someone's i.p adress through msn messenger
item.dc:creator: @therealjdb JDB`
item.description:
@therealjdb wrote:

I have an easier way which I think is more “old school”, its called social engineering.

Read full topic

item.title: Getting someone's i.p adress through msn messenger
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

As far as I remember, in the newest MSN protocol if one party has the file transfer port blocked, you don’t make a direct connection with them. Since you’re going to probably be aiming at noobs who won’t know how to unblock ports this dosen’t work so well anymore.

Read full topic
item.source: Getting someone's i.p adress through msn messenger

(i wonder if it works on Trillian…)[/quote]
As long as you can send a file with Trillian then it should since you are making a direct connection with them.

item.title: Getting someone's i.p adress through msn messenger
item.dc:creator: @Falko222 Falko222
item.description:
@Falko222 wrote:

Obtaining an IP from MSN Messenger.

Step 1 - Start MSN Messenger and login as yourself.

Step 2 - Hit your “Start” button and click run. Type into the white box
“Command” (without the quotation marks)

Step 3 - Type in “Netstat -N” (without the quotation marks) into the
black box and hit enter.

Step 4 - Start a conversation with your ‘victim’ and send them a file.
Once they accept the file Hit your “Start” button and click run. Type
into the white box “Command” (without the quotation marks) and Type in “Netstat -N” (without the quotation marks) into the black box and hit
enter.

Step 5 - Look in the middle column of both your MS Dos boxes and look
in the newer wndow for the IP address that has magically appeared in
the middle column. This is your victim’s IP Address.

Read full topic
